author: Staff Reporter
text:
Liver and two kidneys harvested from 18-year-old

One of the kidneys of the victim getting ready for dispatch to a private hospital in Coimbatore on Saturday.— Photo:Special Arrangement

Organs retrieved from an 18-year-old college student have saved three persons who were getting treated in as many hospitals in the city on Saturday.

The victim Pradeep Daniel, from Veepandi Pirivu, was a first year B.Com student in PSG Arts and Science College.

He was also a very good drummer who represented the institution in various events.

Around 7 p.m. on January 13, the boy was returning home after a practice session with friends.

He was seated as pillion rider in the bike, while his friend was riding it. The two-wheeler met with an accident near Hotel Jenny’s Residency on Avinashi Road. Pradeep suffered head injury and was rushed to Coimbatore Medical College Hospital.

As his condition was not stable, he was shifted to PSG Hospital where he did not respond to treatment.

On January 15, he was declared brain-dead.

His family was informed and they came forward to donate his organs. On Saturday, his liver and kidneys were retrieved in a surgery that went on from 2 a.m. to 6.30 a.m.

The liver was transplanted in a patient at PSG Hospital. His kidneys were sent to Ramakrishna Hospital and KG Hospital.

Pradeep’s father David is a carpenter and his mother Esther Rani is a sales executive in a leading textile outlet in the city.

He also has a younger sister, who is studying in 9th standard.

title: Organs of brain-dead student save three lives
